title: Definitions
context: ยง210D-2 Definitions. As used in this chapter: &ldquo;Community-based economic development&rdquo; means a community institution-building process that results in community-based enterprises and other economic development activities which are designed and implemented by a community; consistent with a community&rsquo;s values, culture, and vision; and intended to increase community control over local resources and decision-making processes. &ldquo;Community-based organization&rdquo; means a membership-based, nonprofit corporation incorporated in the State of Hawaii that is organized and controlled by either a geographic community, a community of identity, or a community of interest and which is directly involved in community-based economic development activities. &ldquo;Community of identity&rdquo; means a group of people who may not live in the same geographic area but who are bound together through a common ethnicity or other personal characteristic such as age or social status. &ldquo;Community of interest&rdquo; means a group of people who may not live in the same geographic area but who are bound together through a common economic interest such as coffee growers or an aquaculture cooperative. &ldquo;Council&rdquo; means the community-based economic development advisory council. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of business, economic development, and tourism. [L 1990, c 111, pt of ยง2; am L 1996, c 192, ยง3; am L 2009, c 124, ยง2]
